Dataset accessor methods¶

xrhelpers.assign_levels(levels=None, **levels_kwargs)¶
postprocess.broaden_gauss(fosc: DataArray, agg_dim: Hashable = 'frame', *, width: float = 0.5, nsamples: int = 1000, xmax: float | None = None) → DataArray¶
Parameters:

  • E – values used for the x-axis, presumably $E_i$

  • fosc – values used for the y-axis, presumably $f_mathrm{osc}$

  • agg_dim, optional – dimension along which to aggregate the many Gaussian distributions, by default ‘frame’

  • width, optional – the width (i.e. 2 standard deviations) of the Gaussian distributions used, by default 0.001

  • nsamples, optional – number of evenly spaced x-values over which to sample the distribution, by default 1000

  • xmax, optional – the maximum x-value, by default 3 standard deviations beyond the pre-broadened maximum

postprocess.calc_pops() → DataArray¶

Fast way to calculate populations Requires states ids to be small integers

filtre.energy_filtranda() → Dataset¶
xrhelpers.expand_midx(midx_name, level_name, value)¶

postprocess.get_per_state() → Dataset¶
sharc_icond.iconds_to_frames()¶
xrhelpers.mgroupby(levels)¶
xrhelpers.msel(**kwargs)¶
postprocess.pca_and_hops() → tuple[DataArray, DataArray]¶

Get PCA points and info on which of them represent hops

Parameters:

frames – A Dataset containing ‘atXYZ’ and ‘astate’ variables

Returns:

  • pca_res – The PCA-reduced pairwise interatomic distances

  • hops_pca_coords – pca_res filtered by hops, to facilitate marking hops when plotting

xrhelpers.save_frames(path, complevel=9)¶
xrhelpers.sel_trajs(trajids_or_mask: int | Iterable[bool | int], invert=False) → Dataset¶

Takes boolean mask (each entry corresponding to a trajectory in MuliIndex order) or an Iterable of trajids. In latter case, will not generally return trajectories in order given. invert=True selects those trajectories not specified.

postprocess.setup_frames(*, to_time: bool | None = None, convert_to_eV: bool | None = None, convert_e_kin_to_eV: bool | None = None, relativize_energy: bool | None = None, relativize_selector=None) → Dataset¶

Performs several frequent setup tasks. Each task can be skipped (by setting the corresponding parameter to False), carried out if appropriate (None), or forced in the sense that an error is thrown if the task is redundant (True).

Parameters:

  • ds – The frames-like xr.Dataset to setup.

  • to_time, optional – Whether to convert a ‘ts’ (timestep) coordinate to a ‘time’ coordinate, by default None

  • convert_to_eV, optional – Whether to convert the ‘energy’ variable to eV, by default None

  • convert_e_kin_to_eV, optional – Whether to convert the ‘e_kin’ (kinetic energy) variable to eV, by default None

  • relativize_energy, optional – Whether to relativize energies, by default None

  • relativize_selector, optional – This argument is passed to relativize, by default None

Return type:

A modified frames-like xr.Dataset

Raises:

ValueError – If a task should be forced (i.e. the corresponding parameter is set to True) but cannot be carried out (e.g. because the dataset was already processed previously)

filtre.truncate(cutoffs)¶
postprocess.ts_to_time(delta_t: float | None = None, old: Literal['drop', 'to_var', 'keep'] = 'drop')¶
